name: HX-20 / HX-21 / Pasopia IQ
keyboard: QWERTY mechanical keyboard with 4 function keys, and arrow keys.
graphics: Mode 2 : 256 x 192 with 16 colors (Hires mode)Mode 3 : 64 x 48 with 16 colors (Multi colour mode)32 sprites
sound: General Instruments AY-3-8910 Programmable Sound Generator3 channels, 8 octaves
ports: 2 joystick sockets, 2 cardridge slots, Tape-recorder connector (1200/2400 bauds), Composite video output, Centronics interface, RF video output, Expansion bus, Stereo audio outputHX-21 : RGB analog video output
description:
This is a classic MSX 1 computer, quite similar to the HX-10, except that the shape is different and there are two cartridge slots.

Its special feature seems to be a primitive word processor software built-in ROM. You need a separate Kanji ROM cartridge for it to work.

Does someone know the other differences?

In its native country (Japan), the HX-20 was also named Pasopia IQ to fit in the Pasopia family developped by Toshiba.

There was also a HX-21 computer. It had some minor design changes: like red line - instead of green - below brand and model names. But the main difference seems to be a RGB video output for the HX-21.

<br><font color="red"><strong>> FIRST AD.</strong></font><br><blockquote>January 1983<br><br> Telcon needed customers payments before manufacturing the systems:<br><br><font color="#666666"> Upon receipt of your check, we will forward an end-user agreement. Allow 6 to 8 weeks for delivery of the units. </blockquote>

<br><font color="red"><strong>> U.S. ADVERT JUNE 1983</strong></font><br><blockquote>Advert said: <br><br><font color="#666666"> With NEC's PC-8800 personal computer, you don't have to ask yourself which comes first, the hardware or the software.<br> It's designed to be uncompromising in both areas. So you come first. In the office or at home.<br> The hardware gives you your choice of 8-bit or 16-bit processors, 5 1/4" or 8" disk drives and standard green or high resolution color monitor.<br> The software includes advanced, user friendly programs for all types of banking, accounting and business management. Plus free WordStar word processing, and MailMerge, Multiplan spread sheet, BASIC (two versions), and CP/M... </blockquote>

Philips VW0020|||80-col dot-matrix printer|||<br><font color="red"><strong>> PHILIPS VW0020</strong></font><br><strong>> 80-col dot-matrix printer</strong><br><blockquote>This printer was a rebadged version of the Seikosha GP-500.<br>  It was a 80-column, 50 CPS model with a 7x5 dot matrix head.<br>  Commodore and Atari used same hardware basis for their MPS-801 and 1029 printers. </blockquote>

emulator.name: openMSX - The MSX emulator that aims for perfection.
emulator.description: This new MSX emulator can reproduce, among many other MSX, MSX2and  MSX2+ machines, both Panasonic Turbo-R models. Be sure to get the catapult frontend and the system roms from FUNET.
